member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetAllGPRMs

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetAllGPRMs method retrieves the current contents of all general parameter registers (GPRMs).

member.param: Pointer to an array of type GPRMARRAY that receives all 16 current GPRM values.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetAllSPRMs

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetAllSPRMs method retrieves the current contents of all system parameter registers (SPRMs).

member.param: Pointer to an array of type SPRMARRAY that receives the address of an array of SPRMs.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetAudioAttributes

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetAudioAttributes method retrieves the attributes of the specified audio stream in the current title or menu.

member.param: Variable of type ULONG specifying the audio stream whose attributes you wish to query. See Remarks.
Pointer to a structure that is filled with the attributes of the specified audio stream.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.
The stream's audio attributes are not available.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetAudioLanguage

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetAudioLanguage method retrieves the language of the specified audio stream within the current title.

member.param: Audio stream number for the language being retrieved.
Receives the language information.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.
DVD Navigator is not in a valid domain.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetButtonAtPosition

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetButtonAtPosition method retrieves the button located at the specified point within the display window.

member.param: Current mouse pointer position as retrieved through the Win32 WM_MOUSEMOVE message.
Receives the index (from 1 through 36) of the button at the current mouse pointer position.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetButtonRect

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetButtonRect method retrieves the rectangle coordinates for the specified menu button.
summary.div: Note This method is currently not implemented.

member.param: Specifies the menu button.
Pointer to a variable of type RECT that receives the coordinates of the button's rectangle.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: This method is currently not implemented

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetCmdFromEvent

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetCmdFromEvent method retrieves an object from an EC_DVD_CMD_START or EC_DVD_CMD_END event.

member.param: Event notification's lParam1 parameter.
Receives a pointer to the interface that is associated with the command that fired the event.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetCurrentAngle

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetCurrentAngle method retrieves the number of available angles in the current angle block and the currently selected angle number.

member.param: Receives the number of available angles. There are up to nine angles in an angle block, numbered 1 through 9. If the value equals 1, then the DVD Navigator is not in an angle block.
Receives the current angle number.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: DVD Navigator is not initialized or not in a valid domain.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetCurrentAudio

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetCurrentAudio method retrieves the number of available audio streams and the number of the currently selected audio stream.

member.param: Receives the number of available audio streams.
Receives the currently selected audio stream number in the current title.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is not initialized or not in a valid domain.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetCurrentButton

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetCurrentButton method retrieves the number of available buttons and the number of the currently selected button.

member.param: Receives the number of buttons available.
Receives the number (from 1 through 36) of the currently selected button.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: One of the pointer arguments is not valid.

Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetCurrentDomain method retrieves the domain in which the DVD Navigator is currently located.

member.param: Pointer to a variable of type that receives the current domain.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetCurrentLocation

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetCurrentLocation method retrieves the current playback location.

member.param: Pointer to a variable of type that receives the playback location information.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is in an invalid domain.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetCurrentSubpicture

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetCurrentSubpicture method retrieves the number of available subpicture streams in the current title, the currently selected subpicture stream number, and the state of the subpicture.

member.param: Receives the number of available subpicture streams.
Receives the number of the currently selected subpicture stream.
Receives a Boolean value that indicates whether the subpicture display is disabled; TRUE means it is disabled.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is not initialized or not in the Title domain.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetCurrentUOPS

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetCurrentUOPS method retrieves a set of flags indicating which navigation commands, if any, the content authors have explicitly disabled for the current disc location.

member.param: Receives a bitwise values. Each bit represents the state (valid or not valid) of a user operation (UOP). If the bit is set, then that user operation is prohibited. See Remarks.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: pulUOPs is not a valid pointer.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetCurrentVideoAttributes

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetCurrentVideoAttributes method retrieves the video attributes of the current title or menu.

member.param: Pointer to a structure that receives the attributes.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetDecoderCaps

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]

The GetDecoderCaps method retrieves the DVD decoder's maximum data rate for video, audio, and subpicture (in forward and reverse) as well as support for various types of audio (AC-3, MPEG-2, DTS, SDDS, LPCM).

member.param: Pointer to a variable of type that receives the information about the decoder.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: The filter graph has not been initialized.

Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetDefaultAudioLanguage method retrieves the default audio language.

member.param: Receives the default language information.
Pointer to a variable of type that receives a value indicating the default DVD audio language extension.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.
DVD Navigator is not in a valid domain.

The GetDefaultMenuLanguage method retrieves the default menu language.

member.param: Receives the language information.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.
DVD Navigator is not in a valid domain.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetDefaultSubpictureLanguage

Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetDefaultSubpictureLanguage method retrieves the default subpicture language.

member.param: Receives the language information.
Pointer to a variable of type that receives one of the allowable values indicating the default language extension.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.
DVD Navigator is not in a valid domain.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetDiscID

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetDiscID method retrieves a system-generated 64-bit identification number for the specified DVD.

member.param: Path of the volume to use for the disc ID. Specify NULL to use the current or default DVD volume.
Receives the 64-bit disc ID.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.
The specified path is not a valid DVD disc.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetDVDDirectory

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetDVDDirectory method retrieves the root directory that is set in the DVD Navigator.

member.param: Pointer to a buffer that receives the path string.
Size of the buffer, in WCHARs.
Pointer to a variable that receives the size of actual data returned, in WCHARs.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: The buffer is not large enough to hold the string.
The DVD Navigator is not in a valid domain.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetDVDTextLanguageInfo

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]

The GetDVDTextLanguageInfo method retrieves information about the text strings for a specified language. The method retrieves the number of strings for that language, the locale identifier, and the character set.

member.param: Zero-based index of the language to query. To find the number of text-string languages on the DVD, call .
Receives the number of text strings for the specified language.
Receives a locale identifier (LCID) that specifies the language in which the text is written. For example, the LCID for "en-us" is 0x0409.
Receives a member of the enumeration. The value specifies the character set of the text string.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: This DVD does not have any text strings, or the ulLangIndex parameter is out of bounds.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetDVDTextNumberOfLanguages

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetDVDTextNumberOfLanguages method retrieves the number of languages in which DVD text strings appear.

member.param: Receives the number of text languages.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetDVDTextStringAsNative

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetDVDTextStringAsNative method retrieves a DVD text string for a specified language, and returns the text string as an array of bytes.

member.param: Zero-based index of the language. To find the number of text-string languages on the DVD, call .
Zero-based index of the string to retrieve. To find the number of strings for a given language, call .
Pointer to a buffer that receives the text string. If pchBuffer is NULL, this method returns the size of the string in pulActualSize.
Size of the pchBuffer in bytes
Receives the actual length of the string in bytes, including the terminating NULL.

Receives a member of the enumeration. The value indicates the type of text string, such as movie title or song name. This parameter can also receive values that are not defined in the DVD_TextStringType enumeration.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetDVDTextStringAsUnicode

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetDVDTextStringAsUnicode method retrieves a DVD text string for a specified language, and returns the text string as a Unicode string.

member.param: Zero-based index of the language. To find the number of text-string languages on the DVD, call .
Zero-based index of the string to retrieve. To find the number of strings for a given language, call .
Pointer to a buffer that receives the text string. If pchBuffer is NULL, this method returns the size of the string in pulActualSize.
Size of the pchBuffer buffer, in WCHARs.
Receives the actual length of the string in characters, including the terminating NULL.

Receives a member of the enumeration. The value indicates the type of text string, such as movie title or song name. This parameter can also receive values that are not defined in the DVD_TextStringType enumeration.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetDVDVolumeInfo

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetDVDVolumeInfo method retrieves the current DVD volume information.

member.param: Receives the number of volumes in the volume set.
Receives the volume number for this root directory.
Pointer to a variable of type that receives the current disc side.
Pointer to a variable of type ULONG that receives the number of titles available in this volume.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetKaraokeAttributes

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetKaraokeAttributes method retrieves the karaoke attributes of the specified audio stream in the current title or menu.

member.param: Specifies the index of the audio stream whose attributes you want to query. See Remarks.
Pointer to a structure that is filled with the karaoke attributes.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.
The specified stream is not in karaoke format.
The DVD Navigator is not in the title domain.
The karaoke attributes for the specified stream are not available.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetMenuLanguages

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetMenuLanguages method retrieves all the languages available for all menus on the disc.

member.param: Pointer to an LCID array that receives the languages returned. To retrieve only the number of languages available for menus, and not the actual languages themselves, specify NULL for pLanguages.
Maximum number of languages to retrieve.
Receives the actual number of languages retrieved.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetNumberOfChapters

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetNumberOfChapters method retrieves the number of chapters in a given title.

member.param: Specifies the title.
Receives the number of chapters for the specified title.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetPlayerParentalLevel

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetPlayerParentalLevel method retrieves the current parental level and ISO 3166 country/region code settings for the DVD Navigator.

member.param: Receives a value indicating the current parental level. Valid parental levels are 1 through 8 if parental management is enabled, 0xFFFFFFFF if parental management is disabled.
Address of a two-byte array that receives the current country/region code (ISO 3166 Alpha-2 Code).

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetState

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetState method retrieves a bookmark containing the disc location and DVD Navigator state information.

member.param: Receives a pointer to the interface of a DvdState object allocated by the DVD Navigator.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetSubpictureAttributes

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetSubpictureAttributes method retrieves the attributes of the specified subpicture stream in the specified title or menu.

member.param: Index number, from 0 through 31, of the subpicture stream to query. See Remarks.
Pointer to a structure that receives the subpicture attributes.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: The subpicture has no defined attributes.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetSubpictureLanguage

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetSubpictureLanguage method retrieves the language of the specified subpicture stream within the current title.

member.param: Number of the subpicture stream for which the language is being retrieved.
Pointer to an LCID that receives the locale information. The language information can then be extracted from the LCID by using the Win32 MAKELANGID macro.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is not initialized or not in a valid domain.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetTitleAttributes

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetTitleAttributes method retrieves attributes of all video, audio, and subpicture streams for the specified title and its menus.

member.param: Variable of type ULONG, from 1 through 99, specifying the requested title number. Specify 0xFFFFFFFF for the current title.
Pointer to a structure that receives the attributes of the menu associated with the specified title.
Pointer to a structure that receives the attributes of the specified title.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is not in the title domain.
The pMenu or pTitle parameter is invalid.
DVD Navigator is not initialized or some other internal error occurred.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetTitleParentalLevels

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetTitleParentalLevels method retrieves the parental levels that are defined for a particular title.

member.param: Title for which parental levels are requested. Specify 0xfffffff to return the parental levels for the current title.
Pointer to a variable of type ULONG that receives a bitwise OR combination of values defined for the title.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetTotalTitleTime

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetTotalTitleTime method retrieves the total playback time for the current title.

member.param: Pointer to a structure that receives the total time in hours, minutes, seconds, and frames.
Receives a value indicating the frame rate at which the disc was authored to play. Specify NULL if you don't want to receive the timecode information.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is not in the title domain.
The title is not a one sequential video title, so the timing information might not be continuous.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.GetVMGAttributes

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetVMGAttributes method retrieves attributes of all video, audio, and subpicture streams for the Video Manager Menu.

member.param: Pointer to a structure that receives the attributes.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.IsAudioStreamEnabled

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The IsAudioStreamEnabled method determines if the specified audio stream is enabled in the current title.

member.param: Audio stream number to test.
Pointer to a variable of type BOOL that receives a value of TRUE if the audio stream is enabled, or FALSE otherwise.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.

member.name: IDvdInfo2.IsSubpictureStreamEnabled

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The IsSubpictureStreamEnabled method determines if the specified subpicture stream is enabled in the current title.

member.param: Subpicture stream number to test.
Pointer to a variable of type BOOL that receives a value of TRUE if the audio stream is enabled, or FALSE otherwise.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is not initialized.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]

The IDvdInfo2 interface reports attributes of a DVD disc or the current state of DVD playback and navigation. The DVD Navigator filter implements this interface. IDvdInfo2 is the companion interface to interface. IDvdInfo2 groups the DVD Navigator's "get" methods and IDvdControl2 groups the "set" methods. Together they provide DVD navigation and playback functionality beyond the DVD Annex J specification.
summary.div: Note The information provided by some of these methods can also be obtained through event notifications sent from the DVD Navigator to the application's message loop. For example, to get the current DVD domain, you can call or you can handle the EC_DVD_DOMAIN_CHANGE event in your application's message loop and extract the new domain from the event's lParam1 parameter.
